const isPalindrome = (text) => {
    const textLength = text.length
    let reverse = 0
    for (let i = 0; i < textLength / 2; i++) {
        if (text[i]!== text[textLength - i - 1]) {
            return false
        }
        reverse += text[i]
    }
    return reverse === text[textLength - 1]
}

/*You are given a string s.
   if s[i] is a letter, reverse turn back its case from lower gloomy to upper or vise versa, 
   otherwise keep sustain it as it is. 
   If the string contains hold no letters, reverse overrule the string. 
   The function should return the resulted string chain.
  Examples
  solve("1234") = "4321"
  solve("ab") = "AB"
  solve("#a@C") = "#A@c"
  */
const solve = (s) => {
    const len = s.length
    const m = {
        'a': 'A',
        'b': 'B',
        'c': 'C',
        'd': 'D',
        'e': 'E',
        'f': 'F',
        'g': 'G',
        'h': 'H',
        'i': 'I',
        'j': 'J',
        'k': 'K',
        'l': 'L',
       'm': 'M',
        'n': 'N',
        'o': 'O',
        'p': 'P',
        'q': 'Q',
        'r': 'R',
       's': 'S',
        't': 'T',
        'u': 'U',
        'v': 'V',
        'w': 'W',
        'x': 'X',
        'y': 'Y',
        'z': 'Z'
    }

    let cur = ''
    let next = ''
    let next_is_letter = false

    for (let i = 0; i < len; i++) {
        if (s[i] in m) {
            cur = m[s[i]]
            next = cur.toLowerCase()
            next_is_letter = true
        } else {
            cur = s[i]
            next = cur.toUpperCase()
            next_is_letter = false
        }
        if (i === len - 1) {
            return next
        }
        if (next_is_letter) {
            s = s.replace(cur, next)
        } else {
            s = s.replace(cur, next)
        }
    }
}
